title: We finally got a "Learn More" button in the client which send us to the Universe Website
body:
https://imgur.com/a/K1KcP

We asked for this feature since forever. Okay, it still is no link to the overall Universe Website, but the first step in the right direction, I guess?
If you click on the "Learn More" button you land on the Universe site of the said champion.

It is only a little featue, but I appreciate it.

Sounds like IE is your default browser.  If you want to change it, then (for Win10):

1. Go to the start menu
2. Click the settings cog shape (just above the power icon)
3. Click System
4. Click Default Apps
5. Look for the 'Web Browser' entry and select the browser you'd rather use.

Other operating systems have similar steps, but the internet can help you out there :D

(Also, yay for a link to Universe!  Finally!)

Sorry to hear that.  It sounds like you've tried everything, but I'm a support player and never give up!!  FIGHTING!

1. Open the start menu and type "Control Panel".  Open it.
2. Choose "View By" and choose an icon size so it's not viewing by Category.
3. Click "Default Programs"
4. Click "Set your default programs"
5. Wait a bit.
6. Find the browser you want in the list on the left, and select it.  Go down to the bottom of the window and click "Set this program as default"

Good luck?  (Sorry if this is old news to you.  Hope you manage to get an upgraded machine soon!)

Can't believe it took so long.
I remember rioters talking about something like this back then when the short lores were introduced,which was back then in season 4 if I remember correctly....

Honestly this is fantastic and I'm disappointed it's happening at the same time as a new champ dropping because it deserves attention.

One of the biggest issues with League Lore is that it often feels out of reach for people who aren't already into it, and this is a solid way to circumvent that issue.

I was aware the post would be buried beneath all the Kai'Sa post, but even if it only small gesture, it finally makes the lore more accessible for non-lore nerds. 
But yeah, the timing is a little bit off.
At long last! This is actually a HUGE step forward for helping the general population of league learn more about the lore.

It's really damn perplexing that we think others would struggle to find access to lore and that the Average Joe apparently needs the assistance. 

I understand the prospects of reaching out to more players. But League's already promoted narrative IP has been ongoing for (4-5) years now. If links are deemed useful to someone, they would have to be extremely naive of these last few years. Perhaps they hardly even play the game anymore and at this point are they even the type to care for what they find anyway?

But hey if links helps everyone sleep better knowing Average Joe has "access" to the lore, then who am I to question the trivial benefit of having them.

I kinda disagree.
Ofc, find the Universe Site isn't that difficult to find, but the Universe site is only promote for new content or an event (Demacia, Piltover & Zaun icon).
Otherwise, the Average Joe doesn't see it.
The truth is the Universe website doesn't make the new lore accessible. There are still things missing on the Universe page (the Demacia Video and Art, for example) and sometimes lore content is hidden in Nexus article (White marking shows that you mastered the shadows, see the Kayn Nexus article). Not consider how often a Riotler does give use the answer in this boards.
I love the lore, I really do. But I hate how hidden it is and how much time I have to spend to find all these lore bits. Not consider, we are still lacking a lot of fundamental world building.

But this lore isn't for the Average Joe. Dont take me out of context, Im not saying it's only for this "niche club" of league enthusiasts. But the only type of person who will bother going down the Rabbit Hole are the type who are already dedicated to the game, in some form of another. And if they are already dedicated to playing the game but still naive of it's lore, then new links isn't going to change much. 

If your Average Joe misses the promoted events, are they going to be gutted by that? Are they going to wish that the lore was MORE accessible?
...    

IDK, agree to disagree I suppose. As much as I'm skeptical any of these links are as useful as everyone else thinks they are, I'm still indifferent about their actual implementation to the client. What will be, will be.
___
